Overall, the teaching assistant for this course was accessible, organized, and able to explain concepts clearly and thoroughly.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?

narratives.question_text: Please identify the teaching assistant with whom you interacted most closely _____________________ .
comments: Instructor: Matthew Baird Archer  Matthew Archer
Instructor: Matthew Baird Archer  Matthew Archer.
Instructor: Matthew Baird Archer  Matthew

narratives.question_text: What were the strengths and weaknesses of your teaching assistant
comments: Instructor: Matthew Baird Archer  Provided very good and useful feedback on the assignments.

Instructor: Matthew Baird Archer  His guest lecture covered an interesting topic that enhanced the overall materials/subject of the course. I thought the actual delivery of the lecture, however, could use some refining--though, surely he has big shoes to fill when being compared to Dr. Dove's lectures! I suggest following more of a script or using more notes in order to refine the eloquence of delivery. Too many words on slides. Overall, the lecture was as good as the other guest lecturers. Excellent move to provide feedback to students during the lecture and use quotes from their papers on the slides. Friendly and approachable TA overall.

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: A great course. Thank you! Unfortunately I don't think I will be able to take more from Prof. Dove given my course of study and the other classes I need to take, but I will try to take Disasters in a future year if at all possible - I certainly want to. And I will be taking Political Ecology with Doolittle next semester as a direct result of this course, so it has already had an effect on my course of study beyond this semester. Thank you!
Answers to Questions 8-10 were regarding the "field trip" to watch a movie in Kroon on a non-lecture day.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: The readings and class discussions provided an opportunity to learn from the literature and other students, and to dig into difficult questions about humans and the environment.
Open discussions among the students, the TA and the professor. Very interesting topics covered in class.

Dr. Dove's lectures are clearly well-refined. I enjoy the dry wit and organized narrative style of the lectures. The accompanying PowerPoint slides won't win awards for style, but are quite helpful and rarely have too much text.
Open discussions during classes.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: Sometimes discussions at the end of class were rushed, and I think the class would benefit from more time set aside for responses to and discussions about student commentaries and the readings.

The lectures, though very good in content, can be delivered in a somewhat monotone voice. Thus, I recommend more frequent breaks. I can concentrate quite well for the first 30-45 minutes, after which I am listening less and thinking more (though thinking on topic!).

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: I think the students, all of us, see the presentation/discussion leading part (second half) as an exercise in demonstrating how awkward we are with the material and with presenting. It feels a bit like performing at a most mediocre level every week. Though, I really enjoy my fellow students' insights. I think roundtable discussions would be more enjoyable and productive. I find that I gained a lot of insight from the lectures, and would like to discuss the lecture and lecture topics, rather than the terrible paper I wrote prior to the lecture.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: This course provided me with an important perspective on the role of people, their knowledge, and their relationship to a place, when thinking about natural resource management and development projects. It gave me the tools to question the underlying assumptions in many environmental management projects, and to think about the role of the people both inside and outside of the institutions doing the "managing".
This course is useful for anyone oriented to social sciences, policy making and politics
This course is critical to identify western scientific bias.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: It was a Foundations course. I originally thought I would take the Policy course, but realized during shopping period that, though it's a great course, I would have learned little given my background in the policymaking process. I took this course thinking it didn't fit my interests as well but that it would teach me more; I was right about the latter, and delightfully wrong about the former. This was a great match for me.
I took this course to gain a deeper understanding of anthropology as it relates to managing environmental resources.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Meet? They exceeded! Great stuff.
Yes
Absolutely. I enjoy reading and discussing these topics and perspectives. I particularly enjoyed learning (via lectures) "how to speak" these topics.
They did.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: During the semester everyone has to lead 3 discussions with other classmates. Presenting each topic from different perspectives and leading the discussion in class is enlightening and helps to understand and analyze the material more profoundly.
We meet as group to prepare the discussion and were able to share ideas and organize our presentation.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Yes, do it!

Don't listen to Dr. Dove about getting started early on your term paper... LISTEN TO ME: get started early on your term paper. How early?Now. Research/read that topic every week, starting now. ((even if it means not reading the materials for the week in quite so much depth)) Then spend at least a month typing out your first draft. You'll be happy for it.
Reading load is very heavy, staying on track throughout the week is essential.
Bring coffee.
